intro: Codonopsis celebica, commonly known as the Celebes monkshood, is a flowering plant native to Indonesia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its striking purple and white flowers. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its stems are hairy and often reddish in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
